title: ICE with -Z nll in modified image-png

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Clone the modified `image-png`.
    ```sh
    git clone -b nll https://github.com/nox/image-png.git
    cd image-png
    ```

2. Build with non-lexical lifetimes.
    ```sh
    RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo rustc -- -Z nll
    ```

3. Observe failure.
    ```
       Compiling png v0.11.0 (file:///Users/nox/src/image-png)
    error[E0499]: cannot borrow `self.decoder` as mutable more than once at a time
       --> src/decoder/mod.rs:109:22
        |
    109 |                 try!(self.decoder.update(buf))
        |                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^ mutable borrow starts here in previous iteration of loop
    ...
    119 |     }
        |     - mutable borrow ends here

    error[E0502]: cannot borrow `self.state` as immutable because `*self` is also borrowed as mutable
       --> src/decoder/stream.rs:164:32
        |
    164 |         while buf.len() > 0 && self.state.is_some() {
        |                                ^^^^^^^^^^ immutable borrow occurs here
    165 |             match self.next_state(buf) {
        |                   ---- mutable borrow occurs here
    ...
    177 |     }
        |     - mutable borrow ends here
    
    error[E0499]: cannot borrow `*self` as mutable more than once at a time
       --> src/decoder/stream.rs:165:19
        |
    165 |             match self.next_state(buf) {
        |                   ^^^^ mutable borrow starts here in previous iteration of loop
    ...
    177 |     }
        |     - mutable borrow ends here
    
    error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
    
    note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
    
    note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
    
    note: rustc 1.24.0-nightly (cfba0d446 2017-12-05) running on x86_64-apple-darwin
    
    note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
    
    thread 'rustc' panicked at 'LocalTableInContext: key not found', src/libcore/option.rs:874:4
    note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.
    stack backtrace:
       0: std::sys::unix::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace
       1: std::sys_common::backtrace::print
       2: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}
       3: std::panicking::default_hook
       4: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
       5: std::panicking::begin_panic
       6: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt
       7: rust_begin_unwind
       8: core::panicking::panic_fmt
       9: core::option::expect_failed
      10: <rustc::ty::context::LocalTableInContext<'a, V> as core::ops::index::Index<rustc::hir::HirId>>::index
      11: rustc_mir::borrow_check::nll::replace_regions_in_mir
      12: <std::thread::local::LocalKey<T>>::with
      13: rustc::ty::context::GlobalCtxt::enter_local
      14: rustc_mir::borrow_check::mir_borrowck
      15: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl
      16: rustc_errors::Handler::track_diagnostics
      17: rustc::ty::maps::plumbing::<impl rustc::ty::context::TyCtxt<'a, 'gcx, 'tcx>>::cycle_check
      18: rustc::ty::maps::<impl rustc::ty::maps::queries::mir_borrowck<'tcx>>::force
      19: rustc::ty::maps::<impl rustc::ty::maps::queries::mir_borrowck<'tcx>>::try_get
      20: rustc::ty::maps::TyCtxtAt::mir_borrowck
      21: rustc::ty::maps::<impl rustc::ty::context::TyCtxt<'a, 'tcx, 'lcx>>::mir_borrowck
      22: rustc_driver::driver::phase_3_run_analysis_passes::{{closure}}::{{closure}}
      23: <std::thread::local::LocalKey<T>>::with
      24: <std::thread::local::LocalKey<T>>::with
      25: rustc::ty::context::TyCtxt::create_and_enter
      26: rustc_driver::driver::compile_input
      27: rustc_driver::run_compiler
    
    error: Could not compile `png`.
    
    To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
    ```
